intro: Cacalia integerrima, commonly known as the purple evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cacalia integerrima is often found in prairies, open woods, and along roadsides.
